item.title: Diablo 4 Leaks New Class Coming to the Game
item.description:
A new leak indicates that Blizzard could be planning to add a new Paladin class to Diablo 4 . If confirmed, the Paladin would be the seventh class in Diablo 4 , which has only added the Spiritborn after its release in 2023.

The Diablo series is one of the most beloved action RPG franchises, and its latest entry was released in 2023. Diablo 4 is currently in its ninth season, called Sins of the Horadrim, which features new Horadric Spells and Jewels, as well as new Dungeon Escalations, Horadric Strongrooms, and more. Season 10 of the popular title is scheduled to be released on September 23.

Leak Indicates New Paladin Class Could Be Coming to Diablo 4

Now, the Spanish Diablo fansite DiabloNext (via Icy Veins) has spotted a new build called "2.5.Xpaladin.67961" on Blizzard’s servers, which may point to an upcoming Paladin class. The Paladin has been one of the most requested Diablo 4 classes since the game's release, and it may be in the early stages of testing. However, not much is known about the possible new class, including its powers or when it’ll be available. Blizzard has already revealed that Diablo 4 will not get any significant updates until Season 10, so gamers should not expect the new class before September at the earliest. Even with the file using 2.5 in the name, it may take a while for the Paladin class to become available, which makes its appearance in 2025 uncertain.

The Spiritborn class was added in Diablo 4 ’s Vessel of Hatred DLC, and it’s speculated that Blizzard may be preparing Paladin for the game's next bit of DLC content. Blizzard has already confirmed that the next expansion will be available in 2026, bringing with it some additional changes such as new ranking and leaderboard systems. In any case, it’s always best to take these rumors with a grain of salt, as Blizzard has not yet confirmed this information at the time of this report.

Right now, Diablo 4 has six classes. Five of them were released with the base game: Barbarian, Necromancer, Sorcerer, Druid, and Rogue, with each covering different niches. The recently added Spiritborn class has been deemed by many to be the best class in the game due to its versatility and powerful melee abilities. As nothing is known about the Paladin, it’s hard to say how it’ll compare to other classes. However, it will possibly follow a similar path to Diablo 3 ’s Crusader, which had a wide range of abilities focused on causing damage, being strong in both melee and at a distance.

item.title: Open-World Games That Get Too Much Hate
item.description:
Summary

  • Anthem's lack of dynamic cities didn't stop it from being a solid game to explore with friends.
  • Biomutant's unique protagonist and world were overshadowed by glitches and a dull story.
  • Chorus's open-world space game was underappreciated despite offering loot and satisfying combat.

It’s not easy getting to a 90 on an aggregate site like Metacritic. It’s not even easy making it to 70 in some circumstances, and open-world games can be all over the board. There is a lot of experimentation out there, and that should be praised even if the game doesn’t turn out as good as Elden Ring , The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild , or Red Dead Redemption 2 .

So, while these open-world games are flawed in many ways, they executed some great gameplay mechanics and ideas that perhaps a sequel could have fixed. Maybe, one day, that can happen. For now, let’s see why these games deserve a bit more praise.

Anthem

Better Play It Before It’s Gone

Anthem
12
7.9 /10
Released
February 22, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Alcohol Reference, Language, Mild Blood, Use of Tobacco, Violence
Powered by

Anthem was not an instant hit, unlike a lot of other BioWare games upon release. It lacked dynamic cities to explore and dialogue options that shaped the story. Instead, it had a hub town that served as a place to launch missions from, and even though it wasn’t another epic RPG, it was a solid game to explore with friends. There aren’t many games like Anthem , and shooting and flying around the lush environments was a treat that people are going to lose in January 2026 when it shuts down for good.

Biomutant

A Unique World And Hero

BioMutant
5 /10
4.5 /10
Released
May 25, 2021

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Alcohol Reference, Blood, Crude Humor, Fantasy Violence, Use of Tobacco
Powered by

Biomutant allowed players to create a cute and fuzzy little critter as their protagonist. They could teach their hero to become a sword, gun, or martial arts expert to take on the world. They could pilot a mech and even learn to fly an old-school airship, but unlocking those two things took time. There were a lot of neat ideas, but glitches and a dull story kept it from becoming something bigger. The later ports and patches did make it better, but by that point, the damage was already done.

Chorus

Have You Even Heard Of This One?

Chorus
Action
Adventure
Flight Simulator
Systems
Released
December 3, 2021

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
T For Teen // Fantasy Violence, Mild Language
Powered by

Chorus is an open-world space game that is nothing like most in the genre, including No Man’s Sky and Starfield . Players never get out of their ship, flying in it for exploration, combat, and everything in between.

Thankfully, the galaxy is full of loot to grab and villains to shoot down. It’s a mystery why it didn’t get as much appreciation, but it could yet again equate to the story lacking punch. Also, because it is space, a lot of the game starts to look the same after a while, which is never a good thing for an open-world game.

Deadly Premonition 2: A Blessing In Disguise

Down In The Bayou

Deadly Premonition 2: A Blessing in Disguise
Action
Adventure
Systems
Released
July 10, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
m
Powered by

Deadly Premonition was not the hottest game on the market, but it gathered a cult following because of the protagonist, Agent Francis York Morgan. That said, even diehard fans struggled to like Deadly Premonition 2: A Blessing in Disguise for a number of reasons. While it had quirky characters, it wasn’t as funny throughout, and some were disappointed that it was a prequel. Also, it completely struggled on the Switch between the frame rate and graphical hiccups. It’s rough, to say the least, but the game's charm, quirkiness, and open world that can be traversed on a skateboard all made it stand out.

Dynasty Warriors 9

Mount Up Musou Fans

Dynasty Warriors 9
Action
Hack and Slash
Systems
Released
February 13, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
T For Teen // Alcohol Reference, Mild Language, Violence
Powered by

Dynasty Warriors 9 was the first game in the series to go full open-world, and it was a bit buggy, to say the least. The draw distance alone made it funny to explore, and some of the quests just locked players out. The Dynasty Warriors franchise was never a top-tier series for everyone, but fans appreciated what it was trying to do for the action RPG genre. In that regard, Dynasty Warriors 9 still delivered as there were tons of varied characters to play with, and mowing down thousands of enemies didn’t lose its appeal.

Forspoken

Bad Protagonist, Good Gameplay

Forspoken
6 /10
6.0 /10
Released
January 24, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Strong Language, Violence
Powered by

What most players had a problem with in Forspoken was the protagonist, Frey, who butted heads with everyone. She could be a downer, and while the open world was large and fun to explore physically thanks to Frey’s parkour moves, there wasn’t a lot to do in it.

Empty open-world games are rarely fun, but the key redeeming quality Forspoken did have was the magic system. It was easy to look cool while flinging fireballs and gusts of wind at enemies, which helped it gather some fans, and combined with the parkour elements, made the game worth playing for those willing to look past the narrative flaws.

Gotham Knights

Not The Arkham Series, But Still Good

Gotham Knights
7 /10
7.7 /10
Released
October 21, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T For Teen // Blood, Language, Use of Alcohol and Tobacco, Violence
Powered by

It’s hard to ever live up to the Batman: Arkham games since they reached a level for Batman that no games had before. Instead of featuring Batman again, Gotham Knights starred his trainees: Nightwing, Batgirl, Robin, and Red Hood. They’re quality characters, but they aren’t Batman, which was part of the problem. Some also didn’t like the loot-based system, which is odd considering it was fun to play with friends. It’s kind of strange how this game was panned as hard as it was because everything worked, other than Batman not being playable.

Mad Max

Bad Timing

Mad Max
7 /10
11
8.5 /10
Released
September 1, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Strong Language, Use of Drugs
Powered by

Mad Max had a couple of things going against it from the gate. First, it was released the same day as one of the best open-world games of all time, Metal Gear Solid 5: The Phantom Pain . And second, it wasn’t as high octane as the film that was released months prior, Mad Max: Fury Road . This version of Max lacked some charisma, as did the world, because it was bleak even though it did tie in to the recent movie. However, players who gave it a chance saw that the driving and shooting segments, while not perfect, were solid enough to enjoy for those looking for a brutal post-apocalyptic game.

item.title: Black Ops 6 Zombies: Hardest Dark Ops Challenges
item.description:
Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 holds specific Dark Ops challenges for Zombies players that will see them unlock unique and secret calling cards to showcase their mastery of skills among friends and other players in online modes. Black Ops 6 Zombies doesn’t have the easiest set of Dark Ops challenges, but they are fun to earn.

Some of the hardest Dark Ops challenges in Black Ops 6 consist of surviving without a zombie touching you or reaching a round within the triple digits that would make any survivor feel safe with a player like that in their squad for a game of Black Ops 6 Zombies.

Updated on August 14, 2025, by Jake Fillery: Black Ops 6 Dark Ops challenges are exclusive to the Zombies mode, and each of them provides XP and a Calling Card. For players who want to earn the rarest Calling Cards in Black Ops 6 Zombies, they might want to know how to do so, and what better way than by checking out the hardest BO6 Dark Ops challenges that could cause some grief and hardships along the way?

14 Involuntary Harm

Get an Uber Klaus Core to Explode an Uber Klaus

The newest Dark Ops challenge, as of Season 5, requires players to play on Reckoning and get 2 Uber Klaus Elite enemies at the same time, where they will need to weaken one to the point where he is one-shot, while the other has been destroyed out of the mech suit and becomes an Uber Klaus Core. In this state, weaken the Uber Klaus Core until it glows blue and is ready to explode, and then make it detonate itself at the Uber Klaus to cause the destruction of its mech suit. It's not overly hard, but it does require a high enough round for there to be 2 Uber Klaus enemies at once, and requires players to risk it all by getting too close to an explosive enemy.

13 Apex Prey

Ride the Z-Rex and Kill it with a Melee Hit

Apex Prey is easily one of the hardest Dark Ops to achieve, simply because the Z.Rex holds strong as one of the strongest boss fights. Players will need to head into Shattered Veil with their best loadout at the ready, and then, they will need to ride the Z.Rex and finish it off with a melee strike. Getting the Z.Rex weak enough is a challenge in itself, due to the Z.Rex growing in aggressive with each phase, but it's also going to be incredibly difficult to ride the Z.Rex, since players have to wait for a tail slam that makes the player jump up, where they can land on the Z.Rex's back to then spam the melee button.

12 Grief Goat

Win 115 Grief Matches

Grief is the permanent game mode added to Zombies, which sees 2 teams of players compete against each other to survive. This 4v4 mode has players battle to see which is the last team standing, and this Dark Ops requires players to win a total of 115 matches. 1 match alone lasts an absurd amount of time, and with a rather loyal player base in Grief, players are going to have to expect to spend a long, long time per match. Not only will these matches last so long, but players need to win 115 of them, which might not be super difficult, but it is going to take days, if not weeks, to complete, along with plenty of patience.

11 Of Legend

Defeat the Guardian Using Only a Sword

The Of Legend Calling Card requires players to defeat the Guardian using only a sword. If players even use anything else, like a lethal equipment, or a rogue bullet to hit the Guardian, then this Dark Ops fails and players must start again. The Guardian is the final boss of the Citadelle des Morts easter egg, so reaching here in itself is quite the journey, but even when taking in only your favorite sword along with perks like Melee Macchiato, players are still going to have a difficult time ahead. We recommend using the Solais Lion Sword, as once it's charged up, players can get armor back with every swing. That, with Melee Macchiato's Vampiric Extraction Augment, means players will be able to repeatedly swing the sword to get both health and armor.

10 Dark Journey

Earn Nebula Camo on 33 Weapons

Acquiring Nebula on any weapon is a grind, but on 33 of them? Players need to dedicate some serious time to get this challenge completed, especially when they basically need to get Mystic Gold on every gun, then Opal, then Afterlife, and finally, Nebula. This is going to take roughly 2,700 kills per gun when one accounts for headshots, hip-fire challenges, and elite/special zombie challenges.

This means that with 33 weapons and no slip-ups, players will kill almost 90,000 zombies just to get this challenge done, whereas for most matches, players will barely get one gun to Mystic Gold, let alone 33 to Nebula, due to the harsh requirements.

9 Fatale

Kill 2 Amalgams with a Single Shot

Amalgams are perhaps the toughest of the Elite Zombies featured, and they can certainly be terrifying, powerful, and annoying all in one, much like how the monster itself is an amalgamation of many zombies all in one. Yet, to achieve this Dark Ops, players must kill 2 Amalgams with the same shot, which can be very frustrating to pull off.

Multiple Amalgams do not begin to spawn until after round 20+, and even so, they are pretty fast and can regain health by eating other zombies, so trying to get them both to one-shot is very difficult. However, perseverance is key, as is a Pack-a-Punched Cigma rocket launcher, or even a hard-hitting LW3 Sniper.

8 Quest Complete (Early)

Complete Main Easter Eggs Before the Release of Directed Mode

  • Liberty Falls Easter Egg Guide
  • Terminus Easter Egg Guide
  • Citadelle des Morts Easter Egg Guide
  • The Tomb Easter Egg Guide
  • Shattered Veil Easter Egg Guide
  • Reckoning Easter Egg Guide

Completing one of the Main Easter Eggs available in Black Ops 6 Zombies is no easy task, nor is it an easy task on any of the previous COD Zombies titles. However, what is known about them is how intricate and fun they are, and how rewarding it is to be one of the few people who have actually joined such a small club of players who have achieved victory within these maps.

When a map first releases, players have a chance to jump in and try to complete the easter egg, which comes at a time when the strategy is perhaps not the most refined, and there are a few nerfs needed for a successful encounter. However, those who dare the challenge and complete it are rewarded with a calling card with a golden skull, but these are limited-time challenges until Directed Mode releases.

7 Social Distancing

Reach Round 20 Without Taking Any Damage

Social Distancing has a pretty tough requirement ahead, as players need to somehow reach Round 20 without getting hit once. That’s not an easy feat by any means, especially on Terminus, where Parasites will spit acid, and across all maps where Manglers shoot a tracking blast from their cannons.

Acquiring Social Distancing isn’t easy, but Liberty Falls is perhaps the best chance players will have due to its open spaces. Try to focus on getting through rounds with scorestreaks to avoid actually being on the ground for combat, and focus on devastating weapons like the Sally & Forth for hard hits on enemies before they can get too close.

6 Good Enough

Reach Round 20 With Your Starting Loadout and No Augments or Upgrades

Good Enough is a pretty ruthless Dark Ops challenge that will require players to reach Round 20 with nothing but their starting loadout. That also includes not having a single Augment, nor using any Perk-a-Colas, any Ammo Mods, or any Field Upgrades—the bare basics only.

For Good Enough, try to bring a weapon like the GS35, as although players cannot get PhD Flopper, they can still maintain distance and shoot their enemies. It’s also a good idea to build the Jet Gun to suck up hostile zombies instantly and remember, it’s still okay to buy armor.

5 Kunoichi

Kill 3 Zombies, 2 Special Zombies, 1 Elite Zombie, With 1 Aether Shroud’s Void Sheath

Kunoichi is going to require players to use the Aether Shroud Field Upgrade, and with it, to kill 3 zombies, 2 special zombies (Manglers), and 1 elite zombie (Amalgam or Abomination) all in one go, which, with regular use of Aether Shroud, that’s just 8 seconds.

However, this is relatively easy to get with the right setup. Firstly, it’s best to do this in Terminus as the Amalgam can be hit with melee weapons as opposed to the hulking monster of the Abomination in Liberty Falls. Now, players should have Melee Macchiato and their melee weapon upgraded with Pack-a-Punch, to then activate Aether Shroud and extend its timer through Void Sheath to kill a total of 6 enemies.

item.title: Wuchang: Fallen Feathers Gets New Update for August 2025
item.description:
The developer of the recently released Soulslike title Wuchang: Fallen Feathers has rolled out a new patch on both PC and console, largely aimed at improving performance and bug fixes. More updates are planned for Wuchang: Fallen Feathers in the future, with developer Leenzee promising to take player feedback into account as it works to further optimize the unique action RPG.

Initially pulling in over 130,000 concurrent Steam players following its release in late July, Wuchang: Fallen Feathers was quickly review bombed on the platform, with many players criticizing its poor performance on PC. The Chinese Soulslike has been praised for its gameplay and unique visuals, and while its performance on console is markedly better than on PC, the community remains frustrated by the numerous issues present at launch. Now, developer Leenzee has released a hefty new update for PC and console, and while players are welcoming the many fixes it introduces, other changes aren't being met as favorably.

The newest patch for Wuchang: Fallen Feathers was released earlier this week for those on PC, and it has now been rolled out for console users as well. The update has made several balancing changes, as many players have found the game's difficulty a little too intense during certain boss fights. Several crash fixes have been implemented on PC, including one caused by unnecessary rendering calls and another impacting players attempting to change their screen resolution. While these improvements are welcome, Wuchang: Fallen Feathers is facing more backlash following the new update, as players have noticed that certain parts of the story have been censored or changed entirely. "This must be the first time I've heard of a story plot change post-release," said one Steam user. The developer has not yet provided an official statement regarding why these changes were made.

Just days after the title's release, the developers of Wuchang: Fallen Feathers began compensating players who had faced issues with the game at launch. After acknowledging the many problems present in the PC version, Leenzee announced that those who had purchased the Standard Edition could snag a free copy of the game's soundtrack, while those who had bought the Deluxe Edition would be treated to a free in-game costume, which will be released at a later date.

Wuchang: Fallen Feathers was one of the year's most highly anticipated day-one Xbox Game Pass releases, and subscribers to Microsoft's subscription service have more launch day titles to look forward to in 2025. Gears of War: Reloaded will be available on August 26, while Ninja Gaiden 4 and The Outer Worlds 2 will be added to the Xbox Game Pass library in October.

Wuchang: Fallen Feathers Update 1.5 Patch Notes (August 2025)

Features/Bug Fixes

* Slight adjustment to the invincibility frames during Wuchang’s get-up animation after being knocked down.

This is to prevent players from being attacked during the getting-up animation to optimize the player’s early game experience.

* Sped up Wuchang’s healing animation slightly to ensure players have enough time to heal. The recovery animation after drinking can now be cancelled with a dodge.

This is to enhance the strategic element.

* Made adjustments to animations, values, and level design for certain NPCs and AI.

Added dialogs for some NPCs to complete some plots. We will further optimize the exhaustion animations in the future to improve the plot performance.

Fixed the faction bug in Chapter 4, adjusted the level design, and increased the performance effect of BVB.

Fixed the dialogue order between Fang Yao and He Youzai to prevent a bug where players could not achieve the “Bound by Fate's Threads” and “Dream's Sweet Deceit” endings due to an incorrect sequence.

* Addressed the issue causing audio playback stutter on certain hardware models.

* Revised descriptions for some equipment and items

* Added/revised certain audio lines.

Added some ‘Wuchang’ voice to complete the story, and added some NPC dialogues.

* Fixed an issue where certain keys could not be set in the key binding menu, and where some key changes could not be saved after re-binding, such as, left shift, left ctrl, left alt.

* Fixed the issue where the Buddha statue could disappear from the player’s inventory when force-quitting the game after it is placed in the Palace Hill of Chapter 1.

* Fixed an issue with the combo-based Benediction and Jade Pendant not functioning correctly in NG+ cycles.

* Addressed issues with certain terrain that can cause the player to become stuck.

* Reduced elevator waiting time and fixed the issue in Chapter 5 where the elevator may trap the player at its destination.

While Wuchang waits for the elevator, the speed of the elevator tripled. Due to loading issues, the speed of taking the elevator is temporarily unchanged.

* Optimized the impact resistance of certain monsters.

Reduce the impact tolerance of some primary enemies, making it easier for light weapons to interrupt the attacks of some monsters in the early stages, while increasing the strategic nature of light attacks.

For later-stage monsters, players can now use spells, weapon skills, etc., to directly perform follow-up light attack combos to suppress some monsters.

* Increased the trigger interval for Spike Traps.

* Further reduced the damage of landmines in Chapters 2 & 3.

Monsters can still be quickly staggered, keeping combat strategies in areas with groups of monsters unchanged.

* Reduced the number of landmines in Chapter 3.

* Adjusted game content to prepare for the update of new weapons and sets in the Deluxe Edition compensation.

Currently, the high-poly phase of the Deluxe Edition compensation content is nearing completion, and we hope to bring players more traditional armor, including ancient armor such as Wei/Jin dynasty armor.

* Optimized game code in preparation for allowing players to choose to respawn at either the Shrine or the BOSS Fight Entrance after death.

* Optimized game code in preparation for future patches to reduce VRAM usage, aiming to address frequent stuttering and other display issues caused by VRAM overflow.

* Optimized asset specifications in preparation for updating to a more noticeable effect when picking up Red Mercury Essence.

* Fixed an issue where super-sampling resolution would apply incorrect parameters when using the Extreme settings on high-end machines.

* Other minor fixes.

Crash Fixes

* Fixed an issue where changing screen resolution under certain conditions could cause the game to crash.

* Fixed shader-related errors that occurred with certain NVIDIA graphics cards.

* Fixed a GPU crash caused by certain semi-transparent assets in extreme scenarios.

* Fixed a crash caused by unnecessary rendering calls in specific scenarios.

* Fixed a crash caused by GPU hangs under specific conditions.

* Fixed a crash that could occur with a certain probability at the end of map loading due to animation blueprint concurrency.

* Other minor fixes.

item.title: Epic Games Store Reveals Free Games for August 21
item.description:
The Epic Games Store has revealed two games that will be available for free on the platform starting on August 21: Kamaeru: A Frog Refuge and Strange Horticulture . These two highly-rated titles promise to offer an exciting experience for Epic Games Store users, and players have the chance to claim two other games while they wait for them to become available.

Every week, the Epic Games Store offers new free titles to its users. Two games were available on the Epic Games Store between July 31 and August 7: Keylocker | Turn Based Cyberpunk Action and Pilgrims . The first one was a cyberpunk turn-based rhythm RPG with pixel art graphics and a challenging combat system. Pilgrims is a short, playful adventure game about traveling and making friends.

Now, the Epic Games Store has revealed that Kamaeru: A Frog Refuge and Strange Horticulture will be freely available on the platform from August 21 at 11 AM EDT until August 28 at the same time. These offerings seem like good picks for players who love genres such as farming sims and puzzle games, and Strange Horticulture boasting an average player score of 4.6 out of 5 on the Epic Games Store. “Very Positive” reviews on Steam and . Developed by Humble Reeds and published by Armor Games Studios, Kamaeru: A Frog Refuge is a cute farming sim in which the player fosters a sanctuary for frogs, restoring the biodiversity of the Kamaeru area. In this farming sim, it’s possible to collect frogs, play mini-games, and more. Strange Horticulture , on the other hand, is a much more well-known mystery puzzle game developed by Bad Viking. The title deals with finding and identifying new plants and dealing with the mysteries of a land with hag-infested forests.

Current Epic Games Store Free Games

  • Hidden Folks (August 14 – August 21)
  • Totally Reliable Delivery Service Standard Edition (August 14 – August 21)
  • Kamaeru: A Frog Refuge (August 21 – August 28)
  • Strange Horticulture (August 21 – August 28)

While users wait to claim these free games, they can still grab some interesting titles from the platform. The Epic Games Store is currently offering two titles until August 14: 112 Operator and Road Redemption . 112 Operator is a strategy management game that puts players in charge of managing dispatches in an array of cities. Road Redemption , on the other hand, is a motorcycle combat game focusing on biker gang battles across the country, and can be played in 4-player co-op mode.

Overall, 2025 has been a good year for the Epic Games Store. The year started with some interesting titles being given away, such as Kingdom Come: Deliverance , Humankind , Dead Island 2 , and Limbo . However, some fans have criticized the recent number of relatively unknown titles offered on the store. Hopefully, the free offerings will continue to be highly regarded games this year, with the storefront potentially even surprising Epic Games Store users with more AAA games.
